introduction: This video discusses the reasons why using SELECT \* in a SQL query can be slow and how it affects performance. The video covers the concept of full table scans, deserialization costs, and network latency. It also explains the importance of indexing and using index only scans to improve query performance.

sections.title: Section 1: Full Table Scans
content: Explanation of how a full table scan works.
Discussion of the impact of full table scans on query performance.
Comparison of full table scans with index-based queries.
Explanation of how to avoid full table scans using indexing.

sections.title: Section 2: Deserialization Costs
content: Explanation of deserialization costs and their impact on query performance.
Discussion of the different deserialization methods used in SQL databases.
Explanation of how to optimize deserialization costs.
Comparison of different deserialization methods and their performance.

sections.title: Section 3: Network Latency
content: Explanation of network latency and its impact on query performance.
Discussion of the different network protocols used in SQL databases.
Explanation of how to optimize network latency.
Comparison of different network protocols and their performance.

sections.title: Section 4: Indexing and Index Only Scans
content: Explanation of indexing and its importance in SQL query performance.
Discussion of the different types of indexes used in SQL databases.
Explanation of how to use index only scans to improve query performance.
Comparison of index only scans with full table scans.

sections.title: Section 5: Best Practices for Query Optimization
content: Summary of the key takeaways from the video.
Explanation of the importance of query optimization in SQL databases.
Discussion of the best practices for query optimization.
Comparison of different query optimization techniques and their performance.
